content:
• Thursday, October 4, 2012
  • MRCY

    Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY) takes a hit in post-session trading after revising FQ1...

    Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY) takes a hit in post-session trading after revising FQ1 guidance lower. The company now says it expects revenue to be in the range of $48M - $50M - including revenues from Micronetics, which was acquired by Mercury on August 8, 2012 - below Street estimates of $58M. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM
  • VSCP

    VirtualScopics (NASDAQ:VSCP) lowers its FY12 revenue view to $12.5M - $13M from its prior $14M -...

    VirtualScopics (NASDAQ:VSCP) lowers its FY12 revenue view to $12.5M - $13M from its prior $14M - $15M estimate, and below current FY12 consensus of $14.3M. The company attributes the downward revision to delays in new study initiations and analysis services, as well as a slow-down in decisions on pending outstanding proposals. Shares -11.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) has resumed trading following its Q3/2012 warning. Shares are down 16.5% AH...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) has resumed trading following its Q3/2012 warning. Shares are down 16.5% AH to a new post-IPO low of $2.35, leaving the company with a market cap of less than $2B. Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) -1.6%. Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 14 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) warns it expects 2012 bookings of $1.085B-$1.1B, below already lowered...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) warns it expects 2012 bookings of $1.085B-$1.1B, below already lowered guidance of $1.15B-$1.225B. The company expects Q3 revenue to reach $300M-$305M (above a $275.9M consensus), but forecasts bookings will amount to just $250M-$255M. Zynga blames weakness in games within its web "invest and express" category (e.g. FarmVille, CityVille). Also, an $85M-$95M write-down is being taken on the OMGPOP acquisition. Shares are halted, and will resume trading at 5.05PM ET.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 9 Comments
  • DTLK

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK) -8.7% after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $105M-$106M and EPS of...

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK) -8.7% after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $105M-$106M and EPS of $104M-$105M and EPS of $0.14-$0.15, below a consensus of $120.4M and $0.23. The data center services firm blames soft customer capex (ed: that sounds strange at a time when data center construction is soaring). Datalink also announces it has closed its ~$16M acquisition of rival StraTech - the deal adds $65M in annualized revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +3.2%) closes the day higher as MKM's Daniel Berenbaum (kind of) makes a contrarian...

    AMD (AMD +3.2%) closes the day higher as MKM's Daniel Berenbaum (kind of) makes a contrarian call, upgrading shares to Neutral. While believing AMD is "still verging on irrelevancy," Berenbaum thinks the chipmaker's problems - said to include execution issues, a weak competitive position relative to Intel in PC CPUs, and a "total lack" of a compelling server CPU offering -Â  are now reflected in its cratered stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • NUVA

    A host of Wall Street firms weigh in on NuVasive (NUVA -34%), cutting their ratings after the...

    A host of Wall Street firms weigh in on NuVasive (NUVA -34%), cutting their ratings after the company lowered its Q3 revenue outlook late yesterday. Barclay's downgrades the shares to Equalweight, JMP to Market Perform, First Analysis to Equal Weight, Summer Street to Neutral, BMO and RBC to Underperform, and Well Fargo to Market Perform. Wells also also hacked it's price target range on the shares to $15 - $16 from $29 - $31.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • THO

    Thor Industries (THO +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform by Wedbush, which cites encouraging...

    Thor Industries (THO +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform by Wedbush, which cites encouraging conversations with recreational vehicle dealers: "The RV market is now at a critical inflection point, with increased confidence likely to drive an acceleration in order patterns over the next several months, particularly in the towables segment where Thor is the industry leader."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • R

    Ryder (R +5.4%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral by SunTrust, which says that while investors may...

    Ryder (R +5.4%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral by SunTrust, which says that while investors may expect the truck leasing company to join the stream of Q3 warnings, it doesn't think R's earnings are at risk. The firm cites aggressive reductions in R's workforce and the managing down of inventory during the summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • ARCH

    Is it a Romney rally? "I like coal. people in the coal industry feel like it's getting crushed...

    Is it a Romney rally? "I like coal... people in the coal industry feel like it's getting crushed by your policies," Mitt Romney said in last night's debate. Arch Coal (ACI +8.7%), which Brean Murray analyst Lucas Pipes says has more leverage to the domestic thermal coal market, continues to push higher (earlier). Also: JRCC +10.8%, ANR +6.2%, CNX +5.8%, WLT +5.1%, BTU +4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 22 Comments
  • CUR

    Neuralstem (CUR +9.5%) trades up after saying it will provide an update on the Phase I...

    Neuralstem (CUR +9.5%) trades up after saying it will provide an update on the Phase I Neuralstem ALS trial of its human spinal cord stem cells, NSI-566, in the treatment of Lou Gehrig's disease. The update will be given by its principal investigator at the American Neurological Association annual meeting on Monday, October 8, 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +24.4%) takes off for the second day in a row following the denial of Google's...

    Vringo (VRNG +24.4%) takes off for the second day in a row following the denial of Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) request for a summary judgment on Vringo's patent suit against the search giant - shares are now up 72% over the last 2 days. Steve Kim, a lawyer and SA author, argues today the fact that court-ordered Oct. 9 settlement talks will take place immediately after a judge hears a Vringo motion for sanctions against Google could give Vringo leverage. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • ESMC

    Shares of Escalon Medical (OTC:ESMC +186%) soar after announcing the sale of its clinical...

    Shares of Escalon Medical (OTC:ESMC +186%) soar after announcing the sale of its clinical diagnostics business to Erba Diagnostics (ERB +13%) for $6.5M. The company notes that adding the sale will have a material effect on future earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -1.9%) briefly turned positive following a Bloomberg report claiming Sprint (S...

    MetroPCS (PCS -1.9%) briefly turned positive following a Bloomberg report claiming Sprint (S -3.6%) is "in the early stages of evaluating a counter offer" for MetroPCS, and could decide on whether to one-up T-Mobile's bid as early as next week. Leap Wireless (LEAP -5.5%), already pummeled yesterday, is near the day's lows following a brief spike. Sprint, which (unlike T-Mobile) uses the same 3G tech as MetroPCS, reportedly had a deal to buy the carrier in February, but its board got in the way.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Midday top 10 gainers: VRNG +22%. ELMD +20%. OTCPK:IFNY +18%. JKS +17%. BSI +17%. CHC +16%. EFUT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: VRNG +22%. ELMD +20%. OTCPK:IFNY +18%. JKS +17%. BSI +17%. CHC +16%. EFUT +14%. ARQL +14%. GNK +12%. NIHD +13%.
    Top 10 Losers: NUVA -33%. INFA -26%. SRPT -16%. TNGN -15%. HMSY -14%. PBM -12%. DAEG -11%. ISCA -10%. QLIK -9%. BPAX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CDE

    If you like silver, Sum Zero says you ought to like Coeur d'Alene (CDE +3.2%) vis-a-vis current...

    If you like silver, Sum Zero says you ought to like Coeur d'Alene (CDE +3.2%) vis-a-vis current silver and gold prices: "Miners are trading at an extreme discount to net asset value, levels that have never been seen before. By investing in CDE, investors are betting that precious metals prices will stay elevated and this gap will close with time."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • JRCCQ

    Coal is now cost competitive with natural gas for power generation, and the industry has seen...

    Coal is now cost competitive with natural gas for power generation, and the industry has seen utilities switching back to coal, which Global Hunter says points to a sooner than expected recovery in fundamentals. JRCC +9.8%, ACI +7.1%, WLT +5.9%, CNX +5.3%, ANR +5.2%, BTU +4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 9 Comments
  • USO

    Also of interest regarding oil's big rise today is noted contrarian indicator Dennis Gartman...

    Also of interest regarding oil's big rise today is noted contrarian indicator Dennis Gartman getting bearish on Texas tea after it's fallen $12/barrel in 3 weeks. "The collapse of the Iranian rial and the possibility of regime change have the energy markets in thrall and rallies are to be sold into!" USO +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -3.1%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. The...

    Polycom (PLCM -3.1%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. The videoconferencing hardware vendor has now been downgraded 9 times since April 5, when it issued a harsh Q1 warning. Subsequent earnings reports haven't helped matters either, as competition from Cisco, Huawei, and startup Vidyo remains intense.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • HAL

    Crude oil futures (OIL +2.2%) bounce off yesterday's 4% drop; traders may be betting that prices...

    Crude oil futures (OIL +2.2%) bounce off yesterday's 4% drop; traders may be betting that prices fell too hard, and Middle East tensions are escalating after Turkey fired on targets in Syria. Oil servicers such as Halliburton (HAL +2.4%) and Schlumberger (SLB +0.8%) are rising, and the move is lifting refiners: TSO +3.5%, VLO +3.3%, MPC +1.3%, WNR +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • ECA

    EnCana (ECA -1%) slides after being downgraded to Sell on valuation at Deutsche Bank. The firm...

    EnCana (ECA -1%) slides after being downgraded to Sell on valuation at Deutsche Bank. The firm says that other than a bounce in natural gas prices, it finds no other justification for the stocks relative value, considering the company's struggling capital efficiency and "challenged underlying production trends."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • ENB

    New Enbridge (ENB +2.6%) CEO Al Monaco kicks off his tenure by boosting the EPS-growth target...

    New Enbridge (ENB +2.6%) CEO Al Monaco kicks off his tenure by boosting the EPS-growth target two percentage points to at least 12% and discussing talks with shippers to get more light-grade crude to refiners in Ohio and eastern Canada through a multibillion-dollar series of expansions and extensions of ENB's pipeline network. BNP and UBS each upgrade shares to Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • QLGC

    Storage adapter card/switch vendors QLogic (QLGC -3.9%) and Emulex (ELX -6.3%) slump after...

    Storage adapter card/switch vendors QLogic (QLGC -3.9%) and Emulex (ELX -6.3%) slump after Credit Suisse starts coverage with Underperform ratings. Shares of both companies have fared poorly this year, as sales of the servers that use their adapter cards remain under pressure in spite of Intel's Romley server CPU launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.6%) announces it completed its strategic partnership with Microsoft that...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.6%) announces it completed its strategic partnership with Microsoft that includes a tidy $300M investment into Nook Media. The company says it won't comment on whether or not a strategic review of Nook Media will result in a strategic separation or the creation of a stand-alone public company, although that's the popular theory with analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • MDT

    Israeli medical device company Given Imaging (GIVN +1.4%) acquires the SmartPill GI Monitoring...

    Israeli medical device company Given Imaging (GIVN +1.4%) acquires the SmartPill GI Monitoring System from The SmartPill Corporation, a U.S.-based firm, for $6M. The SmartPill is an ingestible capsule that uses sensor technology to measure pH, pressure and temperature in the GI tract, and is used to evaluate motility disorders like gastroparesis and constipation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -3.8%) falls again today after the sell-side response to yesterday's analyst day...

    H-P (HPQ -3.8%) falls again today after the sell-side response to yesterday's analyst day remarks and guidance proves as harsh as you'd expect. Barclays thinks H-P's dismal Enterprise Services guidance "highlights structural issues" unique to the company, and notes FY13 free cash flow guidance is well below EPS guidance. H-P now has a market cap of just $28.3B, or a mere 0.23x estimated FY12 revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -2%) slides after Goldman downgrades shares to Neutral, albeit while...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN -2%) slides after Goldman downgrades shares to Neutral, albeit while lifting its target to $23 from $20. The firm sees limited upside following Aruba's recent run-up, and thinks the company's spending will restrain its operating margins. Aruba has been volatile over the last couple of days after announcing it would delay its 10-K filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +5%) continue their winning ways this week to hit their highest level...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +5%) continue their winning ways this week to hit their highest level since mid-August. Though the old mantra that the company sits mired in an industry with low barriers to entry and high barriers to profits still pervades, it seems to be getting a second look with the Internet streaming market still in its early stages and growth estimates set high. (Fresh NFLX backers: Tilson, Citi)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • S

    Sprint (S -2.5%) opens lower thanks to a downgrade to Underperform from Baird, which is worried...

    Sprint (S -2.5%) opens lower thanks to a downgrade to Underperform from Baird, which is worried about competition. Meanwhile, MetroPCS (PCS -6.5%) which tumbled yesterday after the terms of the T-Mobile merger failed to go over well, is falling more following a downgrade to Reduce from Nomura, which doesn't see T-Mobile fixing the carrier's problems. Mobile analyst Henry Wang agrees. "Being No. 4 in this very competitive market is no fun ... AT&T and Verizon can better procure the handsets that people want, and keep costs down as well."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks with ties to China can't get out of the way of a report out of Macau that gambling...

    Casino stocks with ties to China can't get out of the way of a report out of Macau that gambling revenue growth slipped to a 12.3% pace in September. China's national holiday week started this week, so some bullish-leaning analysts remain optimistic that there was a lull before a frenzy. Decliners: MPEL -3.8%, LVS -2.2%, WYNN -1.9%, MGM -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • MUR

    Responding to Third Point appearing to take a more active role in the company, Murphy Oil (MUR...

    Responding to Third Point appearing to take a more active role in the company, Murphy Oil (MUR +1.8%) says the hedge fund "made a variety of suggestions with regard to the company's portfolio and the company values their input... the Board and management have been working to evaluate opportunities."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • TMO

    CollabRx (NASDAQ:CLRX) +68.3% premarket after the data analytics company unveils a multiyear...

    CollabRx (NASDAQ:CLRX) +68.3% premarket after the data analytics company unveils a multiyear partnership with Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) in which its technology will be paired with LIFE's cancer panels.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) now -23.3% following its Q3 warning. Other big data/analytics software...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) now -23.3% following its Q3 warning. Other big data/analytics software plays are also off: QLIK -4.1%. TIBX -2.9%. SPLK -4.4%. TDC -3.9%. Informatica also issued a major Q2 warning in July - back then, the company only blamed Europe's macro issues, but this time, it blames "operational challenges." Informatica hired a new sales chief following its July warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM) reports an initial transplant of neural cells into a patient in its trial for...

    StemCells (STEM) reports an initial transplant of neural cells into a patient in its trial for dry age-related macular degeneration in Dallas. Shares +6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • XSPA

    Premarket gainers: VRNG +7%. STEM +6%.Losers: NUVA -32%. INFA -23%.

    Premarket gainers: VRNG +7%. STEM +6%.
    Losers: NUVA -32%. INFA -23%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM

  • Gold looks set for another run at $1,800/oz. for the first time in a year, +0.8% this morning to...

    Gold looks set for another run at $1,800/oz. for the first time in a year, +0.8% this morning to $1,794. The metal got no assistance today from the BOE or the ECB - both of which left policy unchanged - but the worldwide central bank trend remains one of further ease.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 4 Comments
  • KSS

    Kohl (NYSE:KSS) Sep same-store sales: -2.7% misses consensus of -0.2%. Total sales -1.4% to...

    Kohl (NYSE:KSS) Sep same-store sales: -2.7% misses consensus of -0.2%. Total sales -1.4% to $1.61B. Shares -2.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCN

    Fresh off yesterday's blockbuster purchase of Wilbur Ross' Homeward Residential, Ocwen...

    Fresh off yesterday's blockbuster purchase of Wilbur Ross' Homeward Residential, Ocwen (NYSE:OCN) is reportedly teaming with Walter Investment (WAC) to try and outbid other players for Rescap's mortgage servicing assets. Wilbur Ross - now with a sizable stake in Ocwen - is no doubt pleased. Previously the presumed winner in the race, Nationstar (NYSE:NSM) is off 1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • M

    Macy's (NYSE:M) Sep same-store sales: +2.5% misses consensus of +3.3%. Total sales +2.7% to...

    Macy's (NYSE:M) Sep same-store sales: +2.5% misses consensus of +3.3%. Total sales +2.7% to $2.35B. Shares -2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • EBAY

    Nomura upgrades eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) to Buy from Neutral and takes its price target on shares all...

    Nomura upgrades eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) to Buy from Neutral and takes its price target on shares all the way up to $60 from $43.50. EBAY +1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • CRZO

    Oil India Ltd. and Indian Oil Corp. jointly purchase a 30% stake in Carrizo Oil & Gas'...

    Oil India Ltd. and Indian Oil Corp. jointly purchase a 30% stake in Carrizo Oil &Â Gas' (NASDAQ:CRZO) Niobrara shale assets in Colorado for $82.5M. CRZO holds 61,500 gross acres in the Niobrara basin, of which the Oil India-IOC consortium will have 18,450 acres. The deal marks the first investment by the Indian state companies in U.S. shale assets. CRZO +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • INFA

    Blaming shortfalls in Europe, Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) warns Q3 EPS will come in at just...

    Blaming shortfalls in Europe, Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) warns Q3 EPS will come in at just $0.25-0.27 vs. consensus of $0.34. Revenues are now forecast at $189-191M vs. consensus of $200.65M. Shares are halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM
